org.jfree.chart.block
Class CharterAttributedCharacterIterator

java.lang.Object
  org.jfree.chart.block.CharterAttributedCharacterIterator
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.text.AttributedCharacterIterator, java.text.CharacterIterator
public class CharterAttributedCharacterIterator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.text.AttributedCharacterIterator

Creates out of a AttributedCharacterIterator with subscripts and superscripts a new AttributedCharacterIterator where the TextAttribute.SUPERSCRIPT is translated into a TextAttribute.FONTthat has been appropriately shrunk in size and shifted up/down for a super/subscript.

It also works with multiple fonts in the character iterator, e.g.:

String s = "attributed string of a length long enough to wrap a few times.";
as = new AttributedString(s);
as.addAttribute(TextAttribute.FONT, new Font("Verdana", Font.PLAIN, 72));
as.addAttribute(TextAttribute.FONT, new Font("Times New Roman", Font.PLAIN, 72), 10, 16);
as.addAttribute(TextAttribute.SUPERSCRIPT,TextAttribute.SUPERSCRIPT_SUB, 3, 5);
as.addAttribute(TextAttribute.SUPERSCRIPT,TextAttribute.SUPERSCRIPT_SUPER, 12, 14);


Note that it is apparently important not to create a font per character but reusing them as much as possible, as creating fonts is a time consuming operation ( Java Glossary: Font ).

Author:
hum

Field Detail

SUPER_OFFSET

public static final double SUPER_OFFSET
Fraction of line metrics ascent by which font is shifted down. There is a separate value for Sun's VM version 1.4.x, as it handles this value differently (it appears to double this offset, so we halve it).

SUB_OFFSET

public static final double SUB_OFFSET
Fraction of line metrics ascent by which font is shifted up. There is a separate value for Sun's VM version 1.4.x, as it handles this value differently (it appears to double this offset, so we halve it).

SUBSUPER_SCALE_FACTOR

public static final double SUBSUPER_SCALE_FACTOR
Scaling factor for super and subscript text
